column4: I'm running ubuntu 12.04 and firefox 15.0 and was watching veetle.com content just fine.  Suddenly I now I cannot completely resolve the page.  Anyone else have this issue?
please give the exact URL you were watchin, so I can test it.
watchin => watching
http://veetle.com/index.php/listing/index/entertainment
I get the top bar down to Entertainment/Popular/New and then a huge white space.  I also get their page links at the bottom.  Just how content in between
I see various screenshots of movies, with a "play" sign superimposed on it when I hover over the thumbnails. subman, do you have noscript installed, by any chance?
I can play a movie if I click on the play sign.
it is awfully laggy though. Either many people are requesting the vid or the bandwidth provided by veetle.com just isn't enough...
I used to be able to play them as well early today.  Just not now.  I did do a recent update.  Yes I'm running NoScript but have Allowed this .com site.
I don't even get the boxes with shots of the movies in them.  Just whitespace
1) do you have Adobe Flash Player + all codecs installed from the "ugly" set?
I must as I could play the movies earlier today.
in that case, try clearing the Firefox cache by using Ctrl + Shift + Del. Afterwards close all FF windows and reopen FF again
nope, still no luck
one thing: I did not login to Facebook prior to watching the movie. This may or may not make any difference. I don't have a FB account and I don't plan to.
I have no Facebook account either and it worked fine earlier today
I have another computer here and it works fine on it (running Lubuntu).
try running FF from the command-line to see if the Adobe Flash module spits out any error messages so you can diagnose the issue.
have you updated today?
No errors but it works now when started via command line
and now it works by clicking on the icon.  Very, very strange
Well, it does work. Maybe some cookie needed to reset itself or something similar. Flash Player is a black box and that is exactly the problem...
Yup, go you.  Thanks for the help!
glad to help :-)
